src:
Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Samsung Galaxy M30s, Duel Smartphone Terbaik di Level Rp 3 Jutaan
02 Nov 2019, 03:42 by Mansur
Kameranya Tidak Beda Jauh Kok, Tapi Kemewahan Bodi Jadi Dilema
Oketekno – Pada bulan Oktober kemarin sederet Smartphone murah unggulan, hadir secara bergantian di Indonesia. Ada 4 ponsel yang paling membekas di hati masyarakat, yakni Redmi Note 8, Redmi Note 8 Pro, Samsung Galaxy M30s, dan Realme XT. Masing-masing ponsel ini memiliki kelebihan dan menyasak segmen pasar sama, yakni kelas menengah.
Dalam pembahasan berikut akan disampaikan tentang perbandingan antara Redmi Note 8 Pro dengan Samsung Galaxy M30s. Keduanya memiliki selisih harga cuman Rp 100 ribu saja, dan satunya hadir sebagai raja kamera, satunya lagi hadir sebagai raja baterai.

Baca Juga: 

Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Realme XT, Mana yang Lebih Rekomendasi Untuk Dibeli?


Akan tetapi jangan berpacu pada itu saja, ketahui beberapa perbandingan di komponen lainnya ini lebih dahulu biar bisa memilih ponsel yang tepat, apakah Note 8 Pro yang dipilih atau mungkin Galaxy M30s yang lebih menarik.


Layar & Bodi




Copyright©YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Soal layar Galaxy M30s menang kualitas karena menggunakan panel Super AMOLED yang memiliki tampilan lebih jernih, namun ukurannya seluas 6.4 inci. Berbeda dengan Redmi Note 8 Pro yang menggunakan panel IPS LCD saja, namun punya luas layar 6.5 inci.
Sedangkan untuk masalah kemewahan body, Galaxy M30s kalah premium ketimbang pesaingnya itu yang sudah melapisi panel belakangnya dengan material kaca.  Samsung lebih memilih untuk menggunakan body plastic untuk Smartphone Murah terbarunya itu.

Baca Juga: 

Kata Pakar Soal Kamera 64MP Redmi Note 8 Pro




Performance & Memori




Copyright©YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Tidak berbeda jauh, akan tetapi bisa dikatakan Redmi Note 8 Pro memiliki kinerja sedikit lebih tinggi, dengan chipset MediaTek Heli G90T yang ditanamkan. Sedangkan untuk Galaxy M30s menggunakan chip Exynos 9611 versi standar, alias tidak didukung kemampuan gaming yang lebih layaknya model Pro dari Redmi Note 8 tersebut.
Kemudian untuk opsi memori yang ditawarkan, Samsung Galaxy M30s punya RAM 4GB/6GB dan ROM 64GB/128GB, serta masih bisa diperluas dengan microSD hingga 512GB. Sedangkan Redmi Note 8 Pro menawarkan RAM 6GB/8GB dan ROM 64GB/128GB, serta masih bisa diperluas dengan microSD hingga 256GB.

Baca Juga: 

Sederet Kelebihan Redmi Note 8 Pro Ini Terbukti Muasin Banget di Level Harganya




Kamera Belakang & Depan




Copyright©YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Jelas saja sebagai raja kamera di kelasnya, Redmi Note 8 Pro lebih unggul dengan kamera utamanya 48MP. Belum lagi didukung 3 lensa kamera lain yang beresolusi 8MP Ultra Wide + 2MP Macro Lens + 2MP Depth Sensor. Sedangkan kamera depannya beresolusi 20MP.
Selanjutnya Samsung Galaxy M30s hanya punya 3 kamera belakang saja, namun kualitasnya tidak kalah jauh karena menggunakan kamera utama 48MP + 8MP Ultra Wide + 5MP Depth Sensor. Sedangkan kamera selfie beresolusi 16MP saja.

Baca Juga: 

Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Realme 5 Pro, Harga Sama Tapi Spesifikasi Beda Jauh?




Baterai & Fast Charging




Copyright©YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Beralih ke Samsung Galaxy M30s yang unggul dengan kapasitas baterainya yang sebesar 6.000 mAh. Kapasitas ini jauh lebih besar ketimbang Redmi Note 8 Pro yang cuman menawarkan 4.500 mAh dengan kelengkapan fitur gaming.
Namun kalau masalah teknologi pengisiannya, Redmi masih unggul dengan teknologi pengisian daya cepat 18W. Sedangkan Samsung menawarkan teknologi pengisian daya cepat 15W saja untuk mengisi baterai Galaxy M30s yang monster tersebut.

Baca Juga: 

Resmi! Berikut Harga dan Flash Sale Perdana Samsung Galaxy M30s




Fitur Lain




Copyright©mydrivers

Keduanya sama-sama menggunakan fingerprint sensor yang tersematkan di panel belakangnya. Hanya saja kalau fitur NFC hanya Redmi Note 8 Pro yang punya, sedangkan Galaxy M30s tidak turut mendapatkan fitur tersebut.
Itulah duel antara raja kamera dan raja baterai di level 3 jutaan. Bagaimana, lebih tertarik mana nih? Redmi Note 8 Pro dijual di pasar offline seharga Rp 3.099.000,-, sedangkan Galaxy M30s dalam masa promo ditawarkan seharga Rp 3.099.000,- juga.
baca juga: Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Samsung Galaxy A50s, Harga Mahal Bukan Jaminan?
text:
Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Samsung Galaxy M30s, the Best Smartphone Duel at Rp. 3 Millions
02 Nov 2019, 03:42 by Mansur
The camera is not much different, but the luxury of the body becomes a dilemma
Oketekno - In October a series of superior low-priced smartphones were present alternately in Indonesia. There are 4 phones that have made the most impression in the hearts of the people, namely Redmi Note 8, Redmi Note 8 Pro, Samsung Galaxy M30s, and Real XT. Each of these phones has the same advantages and makes the same market segment, the middle class.
In the following discussion, a comparison between Redmi Note 8 Pro and Samsung Galaxy M30s will be presented. Both have a difference of only Rp. 100,000, and one is present as the king of cameras, the other is present as the king of batteries.

Also Read:

Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Realme XT, Which Are More Recommendations To Buy?


But do not race on that alone, know a few comparisons in other components in advance to be able to choose the right cell phone, whether the chosen Note 8 Pro or maybe the more interesting Galaxy M30s.


Screen & Body




Copyright © YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

The matter of the Galaxy M30s screen wins quality because it uses a Super AMOLED panel that has a clearer display, but its size is 6.4 inches wide. Unlike the Redmi Note 8 Pro which uses IPS LCD panels only, but has a 6.5 inch screen area.
As for luxury body issues, the Galaxy M30s is less premium than its competitors who have coated the rear panel with glass material. Samsung prefers to use plastic body for its newest Cheap Smartphone.

Also Read:

Said the Expert Problem on the Redmi Note 8 Pro 64MP Camera




Performance & Memory




Copyright © YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

It's not much different, but it can be said that the Redmi Note 8 Pro has a slightly higher performance, with the MediaTek Heli G90T chipset embedded. Whereas the Galaxy M30s uses the standard version of the Exynos 9611 chip, aka not supported by gaming capabilities more like the Pro model from the Redmi Note 8.
Then for the memory options offered, the Samsung Galaxy M30s has 4GB / 6GB RAM and 64GB / 128GB ROM, and can still be expanded with microSD up to 512GB. While the Redmi Note 8 Pro offers 6GB / 8GB RAM and 64GB / 128GB ROM, and can still be expanded with microSD up to 256GB.

Also Read:

A series of Redmi Note 8 Pro's advantages proved to be very satisfying at the price level




Rear & Front Camera




Copyright © YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Obviously as the king of cameras in its class, the Redmi Note 8 Pro is superior to its main camera 48MP. Not to mention supported by 3 other camera lenses with 8MP Ultra Wide resolution + 2MP Macro Lens + 2MP Depth Sensor. While the front camera has a resolution of 20MP.
Furthermore, the Samsung Galaxy M30s only has 3 rear cameras, but the quality is not far behind because it uses a main camera 48MP + 8MP Ultra Wide + 5MP Depth Sensor. While the 16MP resolution selfie camera only.

Also Read:

Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Realme 5 Pro, Same Price But Specifications Are Different?




Battery & Fast Charging




Copyright © YouTube @Unbox Gadgets

Switch to the superior Samsung Galaxy M30 with a battery capacity of 6,000 mAh. This capacity is far greater than the Redmi Note 8 Pro which only offers 4,500 mAh with complete gaming features.
But if the problem is the charging technology, Redmi is still superior to the 18W fast charging technology. Whereas Samsung offers only 15W fast charging technology to charge the monster's Galaxy M30s.

Also Read:

Official! The following prices and Flash Sale Prime Samsung Galaxy M30s




Other Features




Copyright © mydrivers

Both are using the fingerprint sensor embedded in the back panel. It's just that the NFC feature only Redmi Note 8 Pro has, while the Galaxy M30s did not get the feature.
That's the duel between the camera king and the battery king at level 3 million. How, which are you more interested in? The Redmi Note 8 Pro is sold in the offline market for Rp. 3,099,000, while the Galaxy M30s during the promo period is offered for Rp. 3,099,000, too.
Also read: Redmi Note 8 Pro Vs Samsung Galaxy A50s, Expensive Price Is Not a Guarantee?
